title: Optimize line height in markdown rendered content
description: Reduce the line height in markdown rendered content to improve visual density and readability. Current line-height of 1.6 for paragraphs and list items appears too large, making the content feel sparse.

notes.content: Clarified requirement: User wants to reduce gaps between text elements (margins/spacing), not line-height property. Need to optimize margin-bottom values for paragraphs, headings, lists, etc.

Optimized spacing between text elements by reducing margins:
- Paragraph bottom margin: 16px → 12px
- Heading margins: top 24px → 20px, bottom 16px → 12px
- H3 margins: top 20px → 16px, bottom 12px → 10px
- H4/H5 margins: top 16px → 14px, bottom 8px → 6px
- Lists bottom margin: 16px → 12px
- Pre blocks bottom margin: 16px → 12px
- Tables bottom margin: 16px → 12px
- HR margins: 24px → 20px
- Also updated alert-specific styling for consistency

context.technicalContext: The MarkdownRenderer.module.css file currently uses line-height: 1.6 for both paragraphs (.markdownRenderer p) and list items (.markdownRenderer li). This needs to be optimized for better visual balance while maintaining readability.
acceptanceCriteria: Reduce line-height for paragraphs from 1.6 to a more optimal value (around 1.4-1.5)
Ensure list items also have consistent optimized line-height
Maintain readability while improving visual density
Test the changes in both regular markdown content and alert contexts
